misc-predictable-rand.description:
Description

Warns for the usage of
std::rand()
. Pseudorandom number generators use
mathematical algorithms to produce a sequence of numbers with good
statistical properties, but the numbers produced are not genuinely random.
The
std::rand()
function takes a seed (number), runs a mathematical
operation on it and returns the result. By manipulating the seed the result
can be predictable.

References
This check corresponds to the CERT C Coding Standard rules
MSC30-C. Do not use the rand() function for generating pseudorandom numbers
.
MSC50-CPP. Do not use std::rand() for generating pseudorandom numbers
.
misc-predictable-rand.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
